newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Euroyen end flat after hitting new high.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Euroyen end flat after hitting new high.

text.p: SIMEX Euroyen futures ended steady on Thursday as the market shed its early gains following an afternoon bounce in the Nikkei.
After creeping up to a new contract high of 99.20 in thin early dealings, March Euroyen finished at 99.17 against its CME close at 99.17 on light volume of 5830 lots.
"It might have been a little bit overbought," said a trader with a U.S. institution. He said the March contract was likely to be supported at 99.15 and at the more solid level of 99.12.
Dealers said sentiment on Euroyen and Japanese government bond (JGB) futures remained bullish on expectations the Bank of Japan would not hike interest rates this year.

December JGBs ended at 122.23 against their opening 122.40. Eurodollar futures were little changed after being glued in a tight band as players sat on their hands ahead of the Federal Reserve's policy-setting meeting on September 24.
The dearth of major economic indicators and uncertainty over the Fed's likely stance on interest rates next week kept trading interest to a minimum, dealers said.
"Eurodollars traded in a one-tick range until the afternoon," said a dealer. The most active December contract finished at 94.08 against its IMM settlement at 94.07.
